body_html:
I'm confused as to why that would matter? I assume (I could be wrong), that MATLAB is calling python commands using a python interpreter; i.e. data in MATLAB environment-->Python environemnet-->Python execution-->MATLAB environment - so python computation can run using one mkl binary and MATLAB uses its own mkl for its computation. Maybe my understanding is incorrect here.

If this is not the case, and for some reason they have to use the same version of mkl, can I force pytorch to use MATLAB's mkl? Are there any options here?
